pageContext.claim: “At the top of the list was the issue of trade — a very important subject — because the United States has been taken advantage of for decades and decades, and we can't do that anymore. ... Last year, they lost eight-hundred -- we as a nation, over the years -- but the latest number is $817 billion on trade.”
pageContext.analysis: The U.S. trade deficit in 2017 was $566 billion, according to the Commerce Department. Trump gets his $817 billion number by looking only at the deficit for trade in goods ($810 billion) even though U.S. trade in services runs a substantial surplus of $244 billion. Moreover, the United States does not "lose" money on trade deficits.
